newsitem.title: INDIA: Foreign buyers propel Delhi shares to higher close.
newsitem.headline: Foreign buyers propel Delhi shares to higher close.

text.p: Shares on the Delhi Stock Exchange rebounded after a weaker start and foreign buyers pushed prices to a higher close, brokers said.
The bourse's benchmark index ended 6.93 points higher at 707.98.
Traders said domestic financial institutions also made some purchases.
"In the wake of rising prices due to financial house buying speculators were forced to square positions," said Sunil Prabhakar of brokers Spurt Securities.
TISCO rose 1.0 rupee to 172.55 on selective buying by mutual funds, while State Bank of India quoted 1.05 rupee higher at 211.25 on speculative buying, brokers said.
Larsen and Toubro gained 2.65 rupees to 213.65.
Reliance Industries eased 0.35 rupee to 190.55 as late demand could not fully make up early losses, brokers said.
